citation.article-title: Mycobacterium noviomagense sp. nov.; clinical relevance evaluated in 17 patients.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Mycobacterium noviomagense sp. nov.

Mycobacterium noviomagense (no.vi.o.ma.gen′se. N.L. neut. adj. pertaining to Noviomagus, the Roman name of the major city in the endemic region in the Netherlands and the location of the reference hospital; current name: Nijmegen).
Colonies are nonchromogenic and appear after 4 weeks of culture at 37 °C, no growth occurs at 45 °C.
Negative in tests for urease, Tween 80 hydrolysis, niacin production, nitrate reductase, acid phosphatase and semi-quantitative catalase.
Can be readily identified by its unique rRNA gene sequences.
The type strain, NLA000500338T (=DSM 45145T=CIP 109766T), was recovered from sputum.
